result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Robert Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles Robert Benson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles Robert Benson was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to Probation in Eau Claire County

timeConds.notes: 30 Days Jail stayed until May 1, 2015 at 7:00 PM.  Jail Sentence may be served in Eau Claire County if the defendant makes the arrangements and at no additional costs to the county. Electronic monitoring not allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Robert Benson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from David Rice inquiring about 14CT122 dismissal.

Defendant Charles Robert Benson in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CT122 heard at this time. OSullivan: guilty to Ct#1 in 14CF205, dismiss Ct#2 and Ct#2 in 14CF205 and 14CT122. 2 years probation with 60 days jail. Loberg and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 14CF205; Loberg stipulates to a factual basis for conviction.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1 in 14CF205. Dismisses Ct#2 and Ct#3 in 14CF205 and 14CT122. OSullivan and Loberg adresses sentencing. Def addresses court. Court: S/W 2 years probation; concurrent with Eau Claire probation. conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, 30 days jail stayed until on or before Friday, May 1, 2015 at 7pm. huber allowed and can be served in Eau Claire if worked out between Sheriff's Dept and there is no additional cost to Pierce County.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Charges are the same as complaint.  Court reads the Information to the defendant.  Defense has a copy of the Information.    Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY TO ALL 3 COUNTS.

1:53 pm   TO INCLUDE 14CT122 FOR SCHEDULING PURPOSES 
Defendant Charles Robert Benson in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrol Officer Donny Knudson sworn and examined by State - Rory OSullivan.  Witness IDs defendant.  Record so reflects.  Loberg x-exams.  State asks that court take judicial notice of Eau Claire Co case 14CF157.  Loberg has no objection.  Court takes judicial notice of Eau Claire Co case 14CF157.  State has no argument.  Loberg has no argument.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Bond to remain as is.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Def voluntarily waives time limits for PH
